items.title: Benamou–Brenier vs Fisher–Rao: Geodesics in OT and IG
items.summary: Explores how Benamou–Brenier geodesics in Wasserstein space compare to Fisher–Rao geodesics in information geometry, and when they coincide.

items.title: Reflexive Mean Field Emergence
items.summary: Mapping psychological concepts like aesthetics, morality, and consciousness onto mean-field dynamics and compression-based dualities.

items.title: From Displacement Convexity to Lasry–Lions Monotonicity
items.summary: Gives a rigorous proof that λ-displacement convexity implies strong Lasry–Lions monotonicity and deduces uniqueness and contraction for potential MFG equilibria.

items.title: The Helmholtz Transformer
items.summary: Formalizes attention-as-diffusion and MLP-as-conservative drift on the sphere, yielding a testable Fokker–Planck model with Schrödinger-bridge editing.

items.title: Compressed Sensing, Superposition, and MLP Potentials
items.summary: Explains MLPs via low-coherence sparse coding, deriving an exact potential and testable predictions for interference and entropy.

items.title: Causality, Abstraction DAGs, and G-Causal Wasserstein Geometry
items.summary: Formalizes abstraction via DAG-constrained OT, adds a causal geometry, and identifies decision points via committors for targeted interventions.

items.title: Geometry-Aware Losses for Language Models: From Cross-Entropy to Wasserstein and Semantic Smoothing
items.summary: Explores replacing cross-entropy with geometry-aware losses in LLMs, using Wasserstein, rotations, and semantic smoothing to exploit embedding geometry for better generalization and calibration.

items.title: Time, Entropy, and Consciousness: Towards a Thermodynamic Formalism
items.summary: Speculative derivation of equations linking time, entropy production, and consciousness, with extensions from Landauer to relativistic field couplings.

items.title: Thermodynamics, Causality, and Fokker–Planck
items.summary: A unified exploration of causality, entropy production, and Schrödinger bridges under the Fokker–Planck framework, with connections to BBGKY and evolutionary game theory.

items.title: Traces of Mathematics: from matrices to curvature and boundary operators
items.summary: A rigorous tour of how 'trace' unifies divergence, Laplacian, boundary restriction, and curvature through index contraction and Stokes-type identities.

items.title: Harmonic functions, Helmholtz eigenbases, and the colour–sound bridge
items.summary: How Laplace, Helmholtz, and Fourier tie heat, waves, Brownian motion, and even colour–sound analogies into one spectral story.
